FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 247 A

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 5. }

HEADQUARTERS DEPT. OF WESTERN CUBA,
Quemados, July 30, 1900.

1. Upon the recommendation of the Acting Chief Sur-
geon, Acting Assistant Surgeon John F. Dunshie, U. S.
Army, now at Guanajay Barracks, will be relieved from
duty at that post, and report to the commanding officer,
3d Battalion, 1st Infantry, for the purpose of accompany-
ing that battalion to the United States on its departure
from that post.

2. Upon the recommendation of the Acting Chief Sur-
geon, Acting Assistant Surgeon Jessie W. Lazear, U. S.
Army, will proceed to Pinar del Rio Barracks, for the pur-
pose of collecting certain pathological material, and ascer-
taining certain facts connected with the recent outbreak of
yellow fever at that post.

Upon completion of this duty he will rejoin his proper
station.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

3. Upon the recommendation of the Chief Paymaster,
the following assignment of paymasters is ordered for the
payment of troops on the muster of July 31, 1900:

Major James W. Dawes, Additional Paymaster, U. S. V.,
Chief Paymaster:
Columbia Barracks;
Pinar del Rio Barracks;
Guanajay Barracks.
Major Otto Becker, Additional Paymaster, U. S. V.:
Hamilton Barracks, Matanzas;
Cárdenas Barracks;
Placetas Barracks;
Rowell Barracks;
Ciego de Avila.

Payments will be made in person, except at Ciego de
Avila, which will be paid by funds shipped by express.

Upon completion of the duty required, the above named
paymasters will rejoin their proper stations.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the trans-
portation for funds and safes required for these payments
to such points as the paymasters may designate. Post
commanders, when requested by paymasters, will furnish
suitable escorts and issue necessary orders for transporta-
tion.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.
